topic: smallest birds in the united states

items.name: Bee Hummingbird
items.details: 2.25 inches, weight of under two grams or less than 0.07 ounces. Found in Cuba.

items.name: Calliope Hummingbird
items.details: Maximum length between three to 3.5 inches and weigh only one-tenth of an ounce. Found across the southwestern United States and much of Mexico.

items.name: Costaâ€™s Hummingbird
items.details: Maximum length of 3.5 inches, weighs no more than 0.10 ounces. Typically found in the southwestern states, but have been spotted as far north as Alaska.

items.name: American Bushtit
items.details: Reaches lengths of 2.8 inches up to 4.33 inches, can weigh as little as one-tenth of one ounce, with a maximum weight of 0.20 ounces.

items.name: Verdin
items.details: Around 3.5 inches with a maximum length of 4.3 inches, weighs between one-fifth and one-third of an ounce.

items.name: Ruby-crowned Kinglet
items.details: Measures 3.5-4.3 inches and weigh in between 0.20-0.40 ounces.

items.name: Lesser Goldfinch
items.details: Weighs between 0.28-0.41 ounces and are between 3.5-4.7 inches long.

items.name: Brown-headed Nuthatch
items.details: Measures 3.5-4.3 inches long with a weight that varies between just over one-third of an ounce to just under one-half an ounce. Found in the southwestern United States.

items.name: Carolina Chickadee
items.details: Measuring only 4.5-5 inches in length and weighing in at around one-third of an ounce.

items.name: American Goldfinch
items.details: Ranges from 4.3-5.5 inches in length and weigh between three-eights and three-quarters of an ounce. Found in the United States, Canada, and Mexico, depending on the time of year.
